newsitem.title: JAPAN: NTT says may take stake in satellite broadcaster.
newsitem.headline: NTT says may take stake in satellite broadcaster.

text.p: Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp said on Friday that it was considering acquiring a stake in PerfecTV, a digital satellite broadcasting service company, through a NTT subsidiary.
"We're considering the possibility. A formal decision has not been made," a NTT spokesman said.
The comment follows a NHK report on Friday that the NTT group would acquire a 2.9 percent stake in PerfecTV for 290 million yen, when it doubles its capital to 10 billion yen.
Japanese law forbids telecommunications companies from entering into the broadcasting business. But the spokesman said entry though a subsidiary is permitted.
PerfecTV, owned by Itochu Corp and three other trading companies, will launch Japan's first digital satellite broadcasting service in October.
Japan Sky Broadcasting, owned by News Corp and Softbank Corp, may tie up with PerfecTV, News Corp chairman Rupert Murdoch said in Japan this week.
